DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Nodal Dissection Stratification Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the coded value related to the type of nodal dissection (the process of cutting apart or separating tissue pertaining to a lymph node), as a stratification point, classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis, for participation in research conducted with human subjects.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to nodal dissection (the process of cutting apart or separating tissue pertaining to a lymph node) as a stratification point, classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis, for participation in research conducted with human subjects.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Property.preferredDefinition: Nodal; of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.:The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure. (MedicineNet.com):The process of classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.
The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.
The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Clinical Study Nodal Dissection Stratification Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numbered system to stratify type of nodal dissection for participation on a clinical trial.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
